creator: Paquin, Elzéar, 1850-1947. (author)
description: Translated title: Riel: Tragedy in four acts // Paquin, Elzéar: 1850-1947. Born and educated in Quebec; physician in Chicago; returned to Quebec; author; Quebec nationalist (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Strongly pro-Catholic and anti-British in tone, Paquin compared Riel to Joan of Arc and Napoleon. Translated by Eugene Benson and Renate Benson as "Riel: A tragedy in four acts" and published in Anton Wagner, editor, Canada's lost plays : Colonial Quebec: French-Canadian drama, 1606-1966 , Toronto: Canadian Theatre Review Publications, 1982 (pp.203-269).
subject: Rebellions and Regimental Histories--Saskatchewan Rebellion
Literary Works--Drama
Drama, French Canadian
French-Canadian Drama
Théâtre canadien-français
title: Riel: tragédie en quatre actes
